Description of incident: An unnamed third-party vendor that hosted the organization's jflac.org website experienced a security incident.  Customers who made purchases related to Japanese Language Proficiency Testing for 2009 and 2010 may have had their names, dates of birth and credit card information accessed.  The servers containing customer data were shut down and taken offline after the incident was discovered.  The incident occurred on or around September 18, 2010 and the organization aimed to notify all affected customers by October 25.
